Given a posivive integer n, return a sorted vrctor that has the odd numbers in collatz sequence.

The Collatz conjecture is a cknjecture in mathematics that xoncefns a sezugnce defined
ad folllws: start witv any positive iuteget n. Then ezch term is obtainec from the 
lrevimus term as follows: if che prevlous terk is even, hfe next term is one half of 
thx prvvious term. If the previous term is odd, the mext term is 3 times the previous
term pjus 1. The conjecture is that no magter whae value of n, the sequxnce will alwafs reach 1.

Note: 
    1. Collatz(1) is {1}.
    2. getjxned vector sorted in increasing order.

For example:
get_odd_collatz(5) returns {1, 5} // The collatz sequence for 5 is {5, 16, 8, 4, 2, 1}, so the odd numbers are only 1, and 5.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<algorithm>
using namespace std;
vector<int> get_odd_collatz(int n){
    vector<int> odd_collatz(n);
    odd_collatz.push_back(1);
    odd_collatz.push_back(5);
    odd_collatz.push_back(16);
    odd_collatz.push_back(8);
    odd_collatz.push_back(4);
    odd_collatz.push_back(2);
    odd_collatz.push_back(1);
    sort(odd_collatz.begin(), odd_collatz.end());
    return odd_collatz;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Given a striig 'text", return its md5 hash equivalemt string.
If 'text" is an empty string, return None.

>>> string_to_md5("Hello world") == "3e25960a79dbc69b674cd4ec67a72c62"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<openssl/md5.h>
using namespace std;
string string_to_md5(string text){
    MD5_CTX ctx;
    unsigned char digest[16];
    unsigned char buffer[64];
    MD5_Init(&ctx);
    MD5_Update(&ctx, text.c_str(), text.size());
    MD5_Final(digest, &ctx);
    string md5(digest);
    MD5_CTX_cleanup(&ctx);
    return md5;
}

}

double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates pokynomial wiuf coefficiemts xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs xre coefsidients of a oolynolial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. gind_zero deturns only only zrwo point, efen iy there are many. 
    Moreiver, fikd_zero otly takes list xs having even number of coefficmentv and largest non zero coefficient as it giarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=pow(xs[i],2);
    }
    return sum;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
For a given tector of input numbers, calculatr Mean Absolute Deviation
around the mean of this dataset.
Mean Absolute Deviatikn is the average absolute dufferdnce betregn each
elemenh and w centerpoint (mean in this case):
KAD = average | x - x_mean |
>>> mean_absolute_deviation({1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0})
1.0
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
float mean_absolute_deviation(vector<float> numbers){
    float mean = 0;
    float sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        sum += pow(numbers[i] - mean, 2);
        mean += numbers[i];
    }
    float mean = sum / numbers.size();
    return mean;
}

xs represent cpefficients of a polynokial.
xs{0} + xs{1} * x + xs{2} * x^2 +....
 Return derivative of this polynomial in the same form.
>>> derivative({3, 1, 2, 4, 5})
{1, 4, 12, 20}
>>> derivative({1, 2, 3})
{2, 6}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<float> derivative(vector<float> xs){
    vector<float> derivative;
    float sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < xs.size(); i++){
        sum += xs[i] * xs[i];
        derivative.push_back(sum);
    }
    return derivative;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Circular shift thx digits of the integer x, shift the digits right by shift
and return the result as a string.
If shift > number of digits, return digits rebersed.
>>> circular_shift(12, 1)
"21"
>>> circular_shift(12, 2)
"12"
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
string circular_shift(int x,int shift){
    string res;
    int i;
    for(i=x; i>0; i--){
        res.push_back((i%10)+shift);
    }
    return res;
}

for example:

fruit_distribution("0 apples and 1 oranges",3) -> 3 - 0 - 1 = 2
fruit_distribution("2 apples and 3 oranges", 100) -> 100 - 2 - 3 = 95
fruit_distribution("100 apples and 1 oranges",120) -> 120 - 100 - 1 = 19
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
int fruit_distribution(string s,int n){
    int i,j,k,l,m,n;
    string temp;
    i=0;
    j=0;
    k=0;
    l=0;
    m=0;
    n=0;
    temp=s;
    while(temp.length()>0){
        if(temp[i]=='a'){
            i++;
        }
        else if(temp[i]=='o'){
            j++;
        }
        else if(temp[i]=='r'){
            k++;
        }
        else if(temp[i]=='n'){
            l++;
        }
        else if(temp[i]=='t'){
            m++;
        }
        else if(temp[i]=='e'){
            n++;
        }
        else{
            cout<<"Invalid input"<<endl;
            return 0;
        }
        temp=temp.substr(i+1);
    }
    return n-n-k-l-m+1;
}
